Articles.Content:
[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Challenge_coin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Challenge_coin)

I'd pay silly money for a KSP challenge coin. But, alas, Google returns 0 relevant hits for "Kerbal challenge coin" at time of writing.

Just thought I'd put that idea in people's heads, sorry. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Maybe one of you talented graphic artists can design a KSP challenge coin that Jeb himself would carry with pride.

I am no good at graphic design, but I was thinking something dignified and not silly or gimmicky would really rock, perhaps something along these lines...

![Wa0QpYy.png](http://i.imgur.com/Wa0QpYy.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-11T17:57:50Z" title="05/11/2015 05:57  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 11, 2015</time> by wossname**
  
added piccie

I'd probably consider buying one too. The problem I have with most merchandising is that you only have so much space for plushies, toys, etc, before you're buried in it, so I tend not to collect much of those, unless I have a good spot for it in my cube at work or something. Collectible coins don't take up much space though.

Would go nicely next to my Assistant Commandant of the Marine Corps challenge coin. While the link I posted to is an Ebay item mine was actually given to me by the assistant commandant. This is just the first pic of it I found.

[http://www.ebay.com/itm/like/231501423836?lpid=82&chn=ps](http://www.ebay.com/itm/like/231501423836?lpid=82&chn=ps)

I love KSP and also happen to make challenge coins. Check out some of our past challenge coins and see what you think. If your interested let me know and I can see if we can make something for KSP.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-08-31T00:19:27Z" title="08/31/2017 12:19  AM" data-short="6 yr">August 31, 2017</time> by Vanamonde**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, embleholics said:
> 
> 
> I love KSP and also happen to make challenge coins. Check out some of our past challenge coins and see what you think. If your interested let me know and I can see if we can make something for KSP.
> 

The link has been removed from your post as it appears that you are charging for this service? Please keep in mind that we do not allow advertising on our forum ([2.2.i)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/guidelines/).

Yeah an official challenge coin from Squad would be super cool.  Been playing since 2014 and I have literally only met one person IRL that plays the game.  I think a design contest and voting thing would be appropriate.  And I don't mind giving Squad more money because I've got at least 1,000 hours in the game...far exceeding the value of my initial 24 dollar investment.  

And I already carry around a 1,700 year old Roman coin from the reign of Emperor Diocletian and some Zimbabwe hyper-inflation notes, so adding a super-nerdy KSP coin would make me even more awesome and eclectic!  lulz...

eta: oh and instead of Latin on the coin, write something cool in Spanish but reversed...like the Chatterer Mod...I think that would be funny...would add another layer of eclecticism and nerdiness....you can never have too much of that.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") 

**Edited <time datetime="2017-08-31T16:30:03Z" title="08/31/2017 04:30  PM" data-short="6 yr">August 31, 2017</time> by netbumbler**
This suggestion has been moved to the Suggestions subforum.

> 
> 
> 13 hours ago, netbumbler said:
> 
> 
> eta: oh and instead of Latin on the coin, write something cool in Spanish but reversed...like the Chatterer Mod...I think that would be funny...would add another layer of eclecticism and nerdiness....you can never have too much of that.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
> 

This

Or maybe '**magis boosters'** or '**Quam durum potest fieri?'**
Make the coin with CAD and distribute the file for 3D printing.  If you can stand the idea of a plastic coin, that is.

The 99 percent invisible podcast had challenge coins made, could likely see where/how they got them.

99pi.org
